meanings.definition: To look or stare in a bold, flirtatious, or impertinent way.
meanings.sent1: She was spiering at him from across the room, trying to catch his attention.
meanings.sent2: He spiered at her with a mischievous grin, making her blush.
meanings.sent3: The cat spiered at the mouse, making playful eye contact.
meanings.sent4: The detective spiered at the suspect, trying to read his expression.
meanings.sent5: The child spiered at the candy in the store, longing to have some.

meanings.definition: Bold, flirtatious, or impertinent in appearance or manner.
meanings.sent1: She had a spiering smile that captivated everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: His spiering attitude often got him into trouble with his teachers.
meanings.sent3: The spiering cat strutted down the street as if it owned the place.
meanings.sent4: Her spiering gaze made it clear she was not to be underestimated.
meanings.sent5: The spiering teenager thought he could charm his way out of any situation.
